chunks.cleaned_english_translation:
The mystery of this ark is explained by the blessed martyr Cyprian in his book on the Simplicity of Prelates, or rather according to ancient manuscripts, in the Unity of the Catholic Church: The bride of Christ cannot be adulterated; she is uncorrupted and chaste. She knows one home and guards the sanctity of one bedchamber with pure modesty. She keeps us for God and assigns to the kingdom the children she has borne. Whoever is separated from the Church and joins with an adulteress is separated from the promises of the Church. He will not reach the rewards of Christ if he leaves the Church of Christ. He is an outsider, he is profane, he is an enemy. He cannot have God as his father if he does not have the Church as his mother. Just as no one could escape who was outside the ark of Noah, no one who is outside the Church will escape. It is certain, therefore, by the preaching of the blessed apostle Peter and the explanation of the holy martyr Cyprian, that the ark of Noah was a figure of the Church, and the waters of the flood were a figure of baptism.

In the house of the prostitute Rahab, who alone was preserved unharmed with all those she had within her when Jericho perished by the command of Jesus, the Catholic Church from the Gentiles was signified in the sacrament of Christian confession, as it seems to me. This Church, having cast off the filth of former fornication, secretly received the two spies of Jesus. This means either the pure knowledge of both Testaments or the love of God and neighbor, for in those two Testaments, the love of God and neighbor is intimated, and on these two commandments hang all the law and the prophets. Matthew 22:40 This prostitute, who was once impious and prostituted to idols, became faithful and chaste by receiving the spies of Jesus. Keeping them safe from pursuing enemies, she did not hide them in the lower parts but secretly concealed them lifted up in the upper room of her house. The upper room is so called because it is bathed in the light of the sun.
chunks.original_latin:
Hujus arcae mysterium Cyprianus beatissimus martyr
scribens in libro de Simplicitate praelatorum, vel
potius secundum vetusta exemplaria de Unitate catholicae
Ecclesiae, exponit: Adulterari non potest sponsa
Christi: incorrupta est  et pudica; unam domum
novit, 376 unius cubiculi sanctitatem casto pudore
custodit. Haec nos Deo servat, haec filios regno quos
generavit assignat. Quisquis ab Ecclesia segregatus,
adulterae jungitur, a promissis Ecclesiae separatur:
nec perveniet ad Christi praemia, qui relinquit (al reliquit)
Ecclesiam Christi: alienus est, profanus est, hostis
est. Habere non potest Deum patrem, qui Ecclesiam
non habet matrem. Sicut non potuit evadere quisquis
extra arcam Noe fuit, sic et qui extra Ecclesiam foris
fuerit, non evadet. Certum est igitur tam praedicatione
beati apostoli Petri quam expositione sancti martyris
 Cypriani, in arca Noe figuram Ecclesiae, et in aquis
diluvii figuram baptismatis exstitisse. In illa quoque
domo Raab meretricis, quae, pereunte Hiericho, sola
est jubente Jesu cum omnibus quos intra se habuit
incolumis reservata, in sacramento Christianae confessionis,
quantum mihi videtur, catholica ex gentibus
significabatur Ecclesia. Quae scilicet rejecta pristinae
fornicationis illuvie, duos exploratores Jesu
latenter excepit: hoc est, sive utriusque Testamenti
castam cognitionem, sive Dei et proximi caritatem:
quia et in illis duobus Testamentis Dei et proximi
caritas intimatur, et in his duobus praeceptis tota
lex cum prophetis pendere cognoscitur (Matth. XXII,
40). Haec quae prius idolis prostituta fuit meretrix
impia, suscipiens exploratores Jesu, facta est fidelis
 et casta: quos custodiens a persequentibus inimicis,
non in inferioribus depositos obruit, sed in solario
domus suae levatos latenter abscondit. Solarium vero
propterea dicitur, eo quod solis lumine perfundatur.

chunks.cleaned_english_translation:
<speak>
  Who is the sun of the human heart, if not the one about whom it was said through the prophet: 
  <break time="0.5s"/> 
  "For those who fear my name, the sun of righteousness will rise with healing in its rays" 
  <break time="0.5s"/> 
  <phoneme alphabet="ipa" ph="mælækai">Malachi</phoneme> 4:2? 
  <break time="0.5s"/> 
  Concerning this rising sun, <phoneme alphabet="ipa" ph="zɛkəˈraɪə">Zechariah</phoneme> prophesies in the Gospel: 
  <break time="0.5s"/> 
  "Because the rising sun will visit us from heaven, to shine on those living in darkness and in the shadow of death" 
  <break time="0.5s"/> 
  <phoneme alphabet="ipa" ph="luːk">Luke</phoneme> 1:78-79. 
  <break time="0.5s"/> 
  The prophet <phoneme alphabet="ipa" ph="həˈbækək">Habakkuk</phoneme> also foretells Christ's ascension and the stability of the ecclesiastical order under the name of the sun and moon: 
  <break time="0.5s"/> 
  "The sun rose, and the moon stood in its place" 
  <break time="0.5s"/> 
  <phoneme alphabet="ipa" ph="həˈbækək">Habakkuk</phoneme> 3:11, according to the Septuagint. 
  <break time="0.5s"/> 
  Therefore, the heart of every faithful person is aptly called a spiritual sunroom, healthily illuminated by the rays of that heavenly sun. 
  <break time="0.5s"/> 
  Thus, Rahab the prostitute, who hid Joshua's spies on the roof of her house, surely kept them in the higher parts, meaning with the enlightened love of a heart illuminated by spiritual knowledge, so that she could sing the prophetic words with the truth of her actions: 
  <break time="0.5s"/> 
  "I have hidden your word in my heart that I might not sin against you" 
  <break time="0.5s"/> 
  <phoneme alphabet="ipa" ph="saʊm">Psalm</phoneme> 119:11. 
  <break time="0.5s"/> 
  True faith, conveyed by divine words, is not betrayed to persecutors but is kept inviolable and safe in the hearts of the faithful if the soul clings to heavenly and spiritual promises, not to earthly, perishable, and carnal things, and looks not at what is seen, but at what is unseen: 
  <break time="0.5s"/> 
  "For what is seen is temporary, but what is unseen is eternal," as the Apostle says 
  <break time="0.5s"/> 
  <phoneme alphabet="ipa" ph="sekənd ˈkɔɹɪnθiənz">Second Corinthians</phoneme> 4:18. 
  <break time="0.5s"/> 
  However, whoever holds the Christian faith to acquire earthly and transitory things places Joshua's spies not in the higher parts of his house, but in the lower parts; where, once they are placed, they can be more easily found and destroyed by enemies. 
  <break time="0.5s"/> 
  For every persecutor and enemy of the Church spiritually kills those whose hearts he finds attached to earthly and perishable things, bringing upon them the destruction of eternal death.
</speak>
chunks.original_latin:
Quis est autem sol humani cordis, nisi ille de quo
dictum est per prophetam: Timentibus autem nomen
meum orietur sol justitiae, et sanitas in pennis ejus
(Malac IV 2)? De ipso sole oriente Zacharias in
Evangelio sic prophetat: Quia visitavit nos oriens ex
alto, illuminare his qui in tenebris et in umbra mortis
sedent (Luc I 78 79). Nam et Abacuc propheta
Christi ascensionem et ordinis ecclesiastici firmitatem
 sub nomine solis lunaeque sic praedicat: Elevatus est sol,
et luna stetit in ordine suo (Abac III 11 sec LXX). Cor ergo uniuscujusque fidelis non incongrue spiritale
solarium dicitur, quod solis illius superni radiis
salubriter illustratur. Raab itaque meretrix quos
exploratores Jesu in solario suae domus abscondit,
utique in superioribus, hoc est spiritali scientia illuminati
cordis intima dilectione continuit, ut propheticum
illud eloquium operis veritate cantaret: In
corde meo abscondi eloquia tua, ut non peccem tibi
(Psal CXVIII 11). Vera itaque fides, quae divinis eloquiis
intimatur, tunc persequentibus non traditur,
tunc in corde fidelium inviolata et incolumis custoditur,
si non terrenis, et caducis, atque carnalibus, sed
coelestibus et spiritalibus promissis animus perseveret
 affixus, nec contempletur quae videntur, sed quae non
videntur: Quae enim videntur temporalia sunt, sicut ait
Apostolus; quae autem non videntur, aeterna sunt (II
Cor. IV, 18). Caeterum quisquis propterea Christianam
fidem tenet, ut res terrenas et transitorias acquirat,
iste exploratores Jesu, non in superioribus domus suae,
sed in inferioribus collocat; ubi cum fuerint positi,
facilius et inveniri possunt ab inimicis et perimi. Omnis enim persecutor et inimicus 377 Ecclesiae
illos spiritaliter interimit, et ipsis ingerit aeternae
mortis interitum, quorum cor invenerit terrenis et
caducis rebus innexum.

chunks.cleaned_english_translation:
While they fear losing or desire acquiring earthly riches, they do not hide the commandments of Christ-the scouts of Jesus-in the attic of their hearts. Instead, they hand them over to persecuting enemies, either terrified by fear or inflamed by corrupt desire.

They lack the scarlet cord, the sign that saved that house, hanging from their window. This signifies that they do not profess their faith but deny the sacraments. The scarlet cord symbolizes the mystery of the blood of Christ. Those who have it hanging from their window, firmly established in faith against pagans or any heretics by God's protection, and carefully guarding their faith, confess that they are redeemed by the blood of Christ.

For this reason, the Savior himself said: "Whoever acknowledges me before others, I will also acknowledge before my Father in heaven; but whoever disowns me before others, I will disown before my Father in heaven" (Matthew 10:32).

So, although the enemy persecutor tries to kill the scouts of Jesus in the lower parts-that is, attempts to weaken the strength of the Christian faith with earthly promises or terrors-if someone has faith in the Trinity, believing the Father, the Son, and the Holy Spirit to be one God, they will not fear all the dark errors, terrors, and traps of the deceiver.
chunks.original_latin:
Hi enim dum terrenas divitias,
aut perdere metuunt, aut acquirere concupiscunt,
praecepta Christi, hoc est exploratores Jesu non
abscondunt in solario cordis, sed tradunt persequentibus
 inimicis, aut metu scilicet territi, aut igne pravae
cupiditatis accensi. Nec funiculum coccineum, in
cujus signo domus illa salvata est, habent per fenestram
domus suae suspensum, qui fidei suae non confitentur,
sed denegant sacramenta. Funiculus enim
coccineus sanguinis Christi mysterium praeferebat:
quem ille per fenestram domus suae suspensum habet,
qui fide contra paganos seu contra quoslibet
haereticos Deo protegente firmatus, ac fidem suam
sollicite custodiens, Christi se redemptum sanguine
confitetur. Propter quod ipse Salvator ait: Qui me
confessus fuerit coram hominibus, confitebor et ego eum
coram Patre meo, qui est in coelis; qui autem negaverit
me coram hominibus, negabo et ego eum coram
Patre meo, qui est in coelis (Matth X 32). Quamvis
 igitur inimicus persecutor exploratores Jesu in inferioribus
conetur occidere, id est robur Christianae
fidei terrenis moliatur promissionibus sive terroribus
enervare; si quis tamen Trinitatis fidem, qua Patrem,
et Filium, et Spiritum sanctum unum Deum
substantialiter credit, in superioribus habuerit collocatam,
omnes persequentis atros errores (forte terrores)
omnesque seductoris insidias non timebit.
